text: Just imagine the productivity boost if every developer could type at 300 WPM for 8 hours straight!
I'd be more concerned about the impending RSI apocalypse.
I heard that RSI is just a myth propagated by slow typists.
Yeah, just like how the earth is flat and moon landing was faked.
At that speed, you'd probably finish a week's worth of work in a day. What would you even do with all that extra time?
Or maybe actually testing their code for once.
Or, you know, procrastinate more efficiently.
I've been training for this! My current record is 275 WPM. Only 25 more to go!
It's all about finger strength and dexterity. I bench press with my fingers every morning.
This would be even better paired with my AI assistant that predicts and writes code before I even think of it. Together, we'd be unstoppable!
Just wait until the AI takes over and starts typing at 300 WPM on its own.
At that point, we won't even need developers anymore. We'll just become professional keyboard cleaners.
I've been typing at 300 WPM for years. The trick is to use a Dvorak keyboard and drink 6 cups of coffee a day.
Dvorak? Pfft, real pros use Colemak.
Don't even get me started on the Colemak vs Dvorak debate! It's like Vim vs Emacs all over again.
Wait, there's a debate? Vim is clearly superior.
